results.title: Road movie = Janice
results.creator_credit: Joseph Strick and Laser Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Two thuggish truck drivers making a desperate fast delivery run across the United States, pick up a prostitute as a diversion. When she offers her body in exchange for the ride the woman, beaten and angry from a previous encounter, begins to experience even more of the degradation she was trying to escape. Rejected and scorned, her feelings of self-pity soon evolve into plans of revenge.

Credits: Producer, director, Joseph Strick ; writer, Judith Rascoe ; photography, Don Lenzer ; editing, Sylvia Sarner ; music, Stanley Myers.
Cast: Robert Drivas, Regina Baff, Barry Bostwick, David Bauer, Regina Baff, Joe Pantoliano.

results.title: Die Flambierte frau = A Woman in flames
results.brief_description:
A raw analysis of class, gender and sex, ‘Women in Flames’ centres on Eva, who one day, without warning, walks out of her stultifying middle-class marriage and into the world of high-class prostitution. Soon she begins an intense relationship with Chris, a fellow prostitute. They move in together but tensions emerge as Eva embraces her sexual freedom and sheds her middle-class moral scruples and Chris’s possessive instincts surface. Set almost entirely in fashionable interiors, stylishly photographed, and with music by Peer Raben the film begs comparison with Fassbinder’s work. Yet Van Ackeren’s film lacks Fassbinder’s assured hand. Cool and distanced, his study of a middle and upper class world ruled by money, power, and sex - where the unexpected and bizarre lie just beneath the tranquil surface, hovers uncertainly between voyeurism and social criticism.

Credits: Director, Robert van Ackeren ; writers, Robert van Ackeren, Catherina Zwerenz ; photography, Jurgen Jurges ; editing, Tanja Schmidbauer ; music, Peer Raben.
Cast: Gudrun Landgrebe, Mathieu Carriere, Hanns Zischler, Gabriele Lafari, Matthias Fuchs.

results.title: Scream 3
results.creator_credit: Wes Craven, Cathy Konrad, Kevin Williamson, Marianne Maddalena, Dimension Films and Konrad Pictures
results.brief_description: The third instalment of the Scream series (Scream 1996, Scream 2 1997) by horror cult director Wes Craven featuring original cast members Neve Campbell, Courtney Cox Arquette and David Arquette along with new members Parker Posey, Patrick Dempsey, Scott Foley and Jenny Mc Carthy.

results.title: Ubu Films: 1965-1970
results.creator_credit: Aggy Read, Albie Thoms, Clemency Weight, David Perry and Ubu Films
results.brief_description: A compilation of experimental shorts made by members of Australia’s first consciously avant garde filmmaking group formed in Sydney in 1965. ‘Blunderball’ (Albie Thoms, 1966), is a parody of James Bond films; in ‘Man and His World’ (Albie Thoms, 1966) a one second image is stretched to fifty seconds; ‘Puncture’ (David Perry, 1967) was created by punching holes in opaque filmstock; ‘Halftone’ (David Perry, 1966) explores the abstract graphic potential of newspaper photographs; ‘Rita & Dundi’ (Albie Thoms, 1966) is a portrait of two women in inner city Sydney; records a ‘happening’ on four cameras; ‘Bluto’ (Albie Thoms, 1967) is a hand-made scratch film; ‘The Tribulations of Mr Dupont Nomore’ (David Perry, 1967) concerns the escape fantasies of a henpecked husband; in ‘Transition’ (Aggy Read,1967) a blank screen is filled with random lines and shapes; ‘Super Block High’ (Aggy Read,1967) is a hand made film created by incising opaque film stock with a grinding wheel; ‘Moon Virility’ (Albie Thoms, 1967) is a hand-made film with a ‘found’ optical soundtrack; ‘Bolero’ (Albie Thoms, 1967) is a n experiment in visual perception to Ravel’s music; ‘Boobs a Lot’ (Aggy Read, 1968) is a montage of Playboy centrefolds cut to the music of the Fugs; ‘David Perry’ (Albie Thoms, 1968) is a ‘synthetic documentary’ of the artist; ‘Tobias Icarus Age Four’ (Clem Weight, 1968); ‘A Sketch on Abigayl’s Belly’ (David Perry, 1968) is a ‘poetic diary film of Perry’s wife’s pregnancy ; ‘Marinetti’ (Albie Thoms, 1969) is a complex ‘longform’ film inspired by F.T. Marinetti; ‘Infinity Girl’ (Aggy Read, 1969) is a film poem with multiple superimpositions; ‘Album’ (David Perry, 1970) is a montage on the theme of the film-maker’s family album.

Marinetti; ‘Infinity Girl’ (Aggy Read, 1969) is a film poem with multiple superimpositions; ‘Album’ (David Perry, 1970) is a montage on the theme of the film-maker’s family album.

results.title: It's a wonderful life (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The philanthropic director of a small savings and loan association on the verge of bankruptcy in a small American town thinks he is a failure and contemplates suicide. His guardian angel attempts to convince him that his life has been far from worthless. A comedy-drama in a fantasy framework which recapitulates Capra’s major themes: the fragility of good and virtue and the ever threatening encroachment of evil. (Awards: nominated for five Oscars, including Best Picture, Best Director and Best Actor).

results.title: Driving Miss Daisy
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Lili Zanuck, Richard Zanuck, Warner Bros Pictures and Zanuck Company
results.brief_description: The funny, touching and totally irresistible story of a working relationship that became a twenty-five year friendship. When Daisy Werthan (Jessica Tandy) crashes her car, her son Boolie (Dan Ackroyd) insists that his mother’s driving days are over. He hires a chauffeur for her, Hoke Colburn (Morgan Freeman) to keep her out of trouble. But feisty Daisy resents the intrusion and she almost drives Hoke crazy with her insistence that she doesn’t need his help. Luckily, Hoke is a very patient man and the pair become the best of friends after 25 years of driving together. Winner of 4 Academy Awards including Best Picture and Best Actress. Screenplay by Alfred Uhry based on his play.

results.title: An introduction to color mixing using the Liquitex Color Map
results.creator_credit: Binney and Smith, Art Products Division
results.brief_description: Russell Woody shows how to mix colour from a visual, rather than a theoretical perspective. Addresses how to select alternate colours to save money, how to correct failed colour mixes with minimal mixing, how to compare colours for opacity, outstanding coverage and transparency and glazes or washes. Provides an understanding of basic colour terms, how one colour can have several names, how words can distort colour vision and how to alleviate the problem.

results.title: Die Zauberflote = The Magic flute / Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
results.brief_description: Wolfgang Sawallisch conducts the choir and orchestra of the Bayerischen Staatsoper, in this often unsuccesful masterpiece. The director, August Everding, in the 27p. booklet accompanying this video, sees Man, bound together by body and soul, as the principal character of this great drama which describes the road from Nature to Civilisation, and which seeks to reconcile the duality of dark and light, good and evil. The singers include Lucia Popp, Edita Gruberova, Francisco Araiza, Wolfgang Brendel and Kurt Moll. Sung in German.

results.title: The Goalkeeper's fear of the penalty = Die Angst des Tormanns beim Elfmeter
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Peter Genee, Filmverlag der Autoren and Osterreichische Telefilm AG
results.brief_description: A professional goalkeeper, for no apparent reason, allows the opposing team to score an easy goal. A few days later he committs an equally motiveless murder. The film follows the goalkeeper’s retreat to a small village on the Austrian border where he spends his time following television accounts of the police search for the murderer. Wim Wenders’ early film is a claustrophobic study of a man alienated from a sterile society to the point where he can only express his loneliness and fear through acts of random irrationality. An early film of the German New Wave of the seventies, “The Goalkeeper’s Fear of the Penalty” uses the thriller genre to explore contemporary questions of social disintegration.

results.title: Six in Paris = Paris vu par ...
results.creator_credit: Barbet Schroeder, Claude Chabrol, Eric Rohmer, Jean-Daniel Pollet, Jean Douchet, Jean-Luc Godard, Jean Rouch and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description: Frustrated in their efforts to find financial backing, six French film-makers took to the streets of Paris with scripts of their own devising and 16mm cameras in this demonstration of low budget, rapid production filmmaking. Many of the directors, actors and cinematographers in this compilation would go on to become central figures of the French New Wave. 1.”Saint-Germain-des-Pres” (Jean Douchet) An American studying in Paris is dropped by one French boy only to be picked up by another 2.”Gare du Nord” (Jean Rouch) A young couple’s row is observed in real time in one continuous take 3.”Rue-Saint Denis” (Jean-Daniel Pollet) A shy dishawasher brings a prostitute back to his room 4.”Place de l’Etoile (Eric Rohmer) A businessman hits a tramp with his umberella and imagines he has killed him 5.”Montparnasse et Levallois” (Jean-Luc Godard) A girl fears she has mixed up letters to her two lovers 6.”La Muette” (Claude Chabrol) A young boy tired of hearing his parents argue buys earplugs and fails to hear his mother’s cry for help. In French with English subtitles.

In French with English subtitles.
